document.discussion_title: The Container Store Group’s (TCS) Hold Rating Reaffirmed at JPMorgan Chase & Co.
document.topic_text: Tweet JPMorgan Chase & Co. restated their hold rating on shares of The Container Store Group Inc. (NYSE:TCS) in a research note issued to investors on Tuesday. A number of other equities analysts have also recently issued reports on the stock. Zacks Investment Research cut shares of The Container Store Group from a hold rating to a sell rating in a research report on Friday, August 12th. Jefferies Group reiterated a hold rating on shares of The Container Store Group in a report on Tuesday, April 26th. Finally, Goldman Sachs Group Inc. lifted their price target on shares of The Container Store Group from $5.75 to $7.50 and gave the stock a neutral rating in a report on Tuesday, April 26th. Two equities research analysts have rated the stock with a sell rating, seven have given a hold rating and one has given a buy rating to the company. The company presently has an average rating of Hold and an average price target of $9.00. Shares of The Container Store Group ( NYSE:TCS ) opened at 5.30 on Tuesday. The firm has a market capitalization of $256.30 million and a price-to-earnings ratio of 49.53. The firm’s 50-day moving average is $5.56 and its 200-day moving average is $5.55. The Container Store Group has a 12-month low of $3.77 and a 12-month high of $17.70. The Container Store Group (NYSE:TCS) last announced its earnings results on Tuesday, August 9th. The company reported ($0.04) earnings per share (EPS) for the quarter, topping analysts’ consensus estimates of ($0.10) by $0.06. The business had revenue of $177.40 million for the quarter, compared to analyst estimates of $848.70 million. The business’s revenue was up 4.5% on a year-over-year basis. During the same quarter in the previous year, the firm posted ($0.11) EPS. Equities research analysts forecast that The Container Store Group will post $0.22 EPS for the current fiscal year. A number of large investors recently added to or reduced their stakes in TCS. Sanders Morris Harris Inc. bought a new stake in The Container Store Group during the first quarter worth about $285,000. Jacobs Levy Equity Management Inc. bought a new stake in The Container Store Group during the first quarter worth about $303,000. A.R.T. Advisors LLC bought a new stake in The Container Store Group during the first quarter worth about $368,000. Renaissance Technologies LLC increased its stake in The Container Store Group by 586.9% in the first quarter. Renaissance Technologies LLC now owns 83,800 shares of the company’s stock worth $492,000 after buying an additional 71,600 shares during the last quarter. Finally, Geode Capital Management LLC increased its stake in The Container Store Group by 20.6% in the first quarter. Geode Capital Management LLC now owns 113,420 shares of the company’s stock worth $665,000 after buying an additional 19,381 shares during the last quarter. The Container Store Group, Inc is a specialty retailer of storage and organization products in the United States. The Company is the original storage and organization specialty retailer. The Company operates in two segments: TCS and Elfa. TCS segment consists of its retail stores, ebsite and call center. The Container Store Group Inc. The Container Store Group Inc.
